ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.crypt

Interface Hash

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JCASHA1, JCASHA256, RIMSHA1, RIMSHA256, SHA1, SHA256

    public interface Hash
    Interface for generating and verifying the hash digest of a message.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
      Returns the name of the algorithm used for hash function.
      byte[] hash()
      Completes the hash computation by performing final operations such as padding.
      byte[] hash(byte[] data)
      Hashes the data provided.
      byte[] hash(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Hashes the data provided using the given offset and length.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the string representation of the Hash's current state.
      void update(byte[] data)
      Updates the digest using the specified array of bytes.
      void update(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Updates the digest using the specified array of bytes, starting at the specified offset.
      boolean verify(byte[] digest, byte[] data)
      Verifies the digest for the data provided.
      boolean verify(byte[] digest, byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Verifies the digest for the data provided, starting at the provided offset.

            throws OTRCryptException

      • update

        void update(byte[] data,
          int offset,
          int length)
            throws OTRCryptException
        Updates the digest using the specified array of bytes, starting at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be processed.
        offset - the offset to start from in the array of bytes.
        length - the number of bytes to use, starting at offset.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException

      • hash

        byte[] hash()
            throws OTRCryptException
        Completes the hash computation by performing final operations such as padding. The digest is reset after this call is made.
        Parameters:
        void. -
        Returns:
        the digest.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException

        Hashes the data provided.
        Parameters:

        the digest.
        Throws:

      • hash

        byte[] hash(byte[] data,
          int offset,
          int length)
            throws OTRCryptException
        Hashes the data provided using the given offset and length.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be hashed.
        offset - the offset to start from the array of bytes.
        length - the number of bytes to use following the offset.
        Returns:
        the digest.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException

      • verify

        boolean verify(byte[] digest,
             byte[] data)
               throws OTRCryptException
        Verifies the digest for the data provided.
        Parameters:
        digest - the digest bytes to be verified.
        data - the data to be verified against.
        Returns:
        true if the digest is verified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException

      • verify

        boolean verify(byte[] digest,
             byte[] data,
             int offset,
             int length)
               throws OTRCryptException
        Verifies the digest for the data provided, starting at the provided offset.
        Parameters:
        digest - the digest bytes to be verified.
        data - the data to be verified against.
        offset - the offset to start from in the array of bytes.
        length - the number of bytes to use following the offset.
        Returns:
        true if the digest is verified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException
